info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:01PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Yuma County through 530 PM MDT... At 501 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles northeast of Cope, or 22 miles northwest of Bonny Reservoir, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Yuma County, including the following locations... Idalia. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 220 and 225. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
